data.question: What is the primary purpose of the activation function in a neural network?
options: To introduce non-linearity to the model
To reduce the dimensionality of the data
To increase the number of parameters in the model
data.correct_answer: To introduce non-linearity to the model

data.question: Which of the following deep learning architectures is commonly used for image classification tasks?
What is the name of the algorithm used to train neural networks by minimizing the loss function?
What is the term for the phenomenon where a neural network is unable to generalize well to new, unseen data?
What is the primary purpose of the pooling layer in a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)?
options: To reduce the dimensionality of the feature maps
To increase the number of feature maps
To introduce non-linearity into the model
data.correct_answer: To reduce the dimensionality of the feature maps

data.question: Which of the following deep learning architectures is particularly well-suited for sequential data, such as time series or natural language processing?
What is the term for the process of adjusting the model's parameters to minimize the loss function?
Which of the following techniques is used to prevent overfitting in deep neural networks?
What is the purpose of the softmax activation function in the output layer of a classification model?
options: To introduce non-linearity into the model
To increase the dimensionality of the output

data.question: Which of the following deep learning frameworks is primarily developed by Google?
What is the term for the process of training a model on a large dataset to learn general features, and then fine-tuning the model on a smaller dataset for a specific task?
Which of the following types of neural networks is particularly well-suited for image generation tasks?
What is the purpose of the batch normalization layer in a deep neural network?
options: To normalize the activations of each layer
To reduce the dimensionality of the feature maps
To increase the number of feature maps
data.correct_answer: To normalize the activations of each layer

data.question: Which of the following metrics is commonly used to evaluate the performance of a classification model?
Which of the following is a type of recurrent neural network (RNN) designed to handle the vanishing gradient problem?
What is the primary advantage of using a Residual Network (ResNet) over a traditional Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)?
options: ResNet can handle larger input images
ResNet is less prone to vanishing gradients
data.correct_answer: ResNet is less prone to vanishing gradients

data.question: Which of the following techniques is used to regularize the weights of a neural network?
What is the primary function of the rectified linear unit (ReLU) activation function?
options: To introduce non-linearity into the model
To normalize the output of the model
To reduce the dimensionality of the input data
To increase the computational cost of the model
data.correct_answer: To introduce non-linearity into the model

data.question: Which of the following types of neural networks is particularly well-suited for image segmentation tasks?
What is the primary advantage of using a Transfer Learning approach in deep learning?
options: It allows for faster training times
It reduces the need for large amounts of labeled data
It improves the model's ability to generalize to new tasks

data.question: Which of the following metrics is commonly used to evaluate the performance of a neural network on a classification task?
What is the primary function of the batch normalization layer in a neural network?
options: To normalize the output of the model
To reduce the dimensionality of the feature maps
To increase the computational cost of the model

data.question: Which of the following types of neural networks is particularly well-suited for natural language processing tasks?
What is the primary advantage of using a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) over a Variational Autoencoder (VAE)?
options: GANs can handle larger input images
GANs can generate more realistic samples
data.correct_answer: GANs can generate more realistic samples

data.question: Which of the following techniques is used to improve the stability of a neural network during training?
